Package: gov.noaa.messageapi.interfaces

[Java] Interface IRejection

  • The IRejection serves as a device for recording what IRecords are rejected during processing, either in filtering, factoring, transformation, or endpoint operations, or otherwise. Every rejection holds a reference to the record that was rejected and one or more reasons for rejection, recorded as Strings.

    Authors:
    Ryan Berkheimer

    • Methods Summary

        Methods 
        Type Params Return Type Name and description
        void addReason(java.lang.String reason)
        Adds a reason for rejection to the current list of reasons.
        IRejection getCopy()
        Returns a deep-copy of the rejection in the current state.
        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getReasons()
        Returns a list of reasons (as strings) for the rejection.
        IRecord getRecord()
        Returns the record that the rejection references.

    • Method Detail

      • public void addReason(java.lang.String reason)

        Adds a reason for rejection to the current list of reasons.

      • public IRejection getCopy()

        Returns a deep-copy of the rejection in the current state.

      • public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getReasons()

        Returns a list of reasons (as strings) for the rejection. These reasons could be anything and can be used for different purposes, i.e., automation of retry, re-routing, etc.

      • public IRecord getRecord()

        Returns the record that the rejection references.
